info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 12:57PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Jackson and southern Haywood Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1256 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northwest of Waynesville, or near Maggie Valley, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Waynesville, Lake Junaluska, Clyde, Maggie Valley, Balsam, Blue Ridge Parkway-Smoky Mountains To Balsam Gap, Blue Ridge Parkway-Balsam Gap To Black Balsam Area, Smoky Mountains-Cataloochee and Cove Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
